column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,32,9d33f484e032418f12f780990e81be374cae2d739776eca975d57649f291d064,"This deactivates the output briefly (= ""dark period""). A sufficiently inactive actuator does not respond to this and remains activated. Each output channel has its own configurable maximum readback time for the dark test. Configure these parameters so that the module reads back correctly and your actuator still does not react to the switch-off pulse.

The ""short-circuit level"" parameter determines the value of the load which, if undershot, leads to the module diagnosing a short circuit and switching off the channel. This means that in the range between employing the current limiting (the inflection point on the output curve) and the reaching of the short-circuit level, no diagnostics are transmitted. The channel remains switched on until the load undershoots the short-circuit level.
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules
If you use the parameter ""overload"" in addition to the parameter ""short-circuit level"", the following will result:

- In the range between employing the current limiting (the inflection point on the output curve) up to the reaching of the short-circuit level, an ""overload"" diagnostic is transmitted and an entry in the diagnostic buffer is made, without the module switching off the channel.
- The ""short-circuit level"" parameter in turn determines the value of the load which, if undershot, leads to the module diagnosing a short circuit and switching off the channel.
# 6.4.14 Parameter assignment for EM 4 F-AI Ex HART
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

The electronic module is HART Fast Mode-capable and supports the processing of HART commands as an SHC (Successive HART Command) sequence. If a HART command is detected by the electronic module with a set SHC bit for a channel, the complete HART command processing is reserved for approx. ",What is the purpose of the 'dark period' in the context of actuator output channels?,The 'dark period' temporarily deactivates the output to test the actuator's response without triggering an actual switch-off.,It serves as a test phase where the output is briefly deactivated to ensure the actuator remains activated if sufficiently inactive.,A configurable maximum readback time for the dark test allows the module to verify correct operation without affecting the actuator.,"To prevent unnecessary reactions, the 'dark period' checks the actuator's inactivity during a brief output deactivation.",The 'dark period' is a safety feature that tests actuator response to a switch-off pulse without causing an actual shutdown.

",How does the 'short-circuit level' parameter function in the module's diagnostics?,The 'short-circuit level' parameter defines the load value below which the module diagnoses a short circuit and turns off the channel.,"It triggers a channel shutdown when the load falls below a specified threshold, indicating a short circuit.",Diagnostics for a short circuit are activated only when the load undershoots the 'short-circuit level'.,"Between current limiting and the short-circuit level, no diagnostics are transmitted, but the channel remains on.",The module uses the 'short-circuit level' to detect and respond to potentially dangerous short-circuit conditions.

",What additional diagnostic feature is provided when both 'overload' and 'short-circuit level' parameters are used?,Using both parameters enables the module to transmit an 'overload' diagnostic and log it in the diagnostic buffer without shutting down the channel.,"An 'overload' diagnostic is generated between the current limiting point and the short-circuit level, with no channel shutdown.",The combination allows for early detection of overload conditions while still protecting against short circuits.,"It provides a two-tiered diagnostic approach, signaling overloads before reaching the critical short-circuit level.",This setup enhances safety by monitoring for overloads while maintaining protection against short circuits.

",What is the significance of the 'HART Fast Mode' in the EM 4 F-AI Ex HART module?,"'HART Fast Mode' enables the module to efficiently process HART commands as an SHC sequence, reserving command processing time.","It supports the processing of HART commands in a dedicated sequence, ensuring timely and orderly command execution.","The mode is designed for rapid handling of HART commands, optimizing communication between the module and HART devices.","By setting the SHC bit, the module allocates exclusive processing time for complete HART command execution.",'HART Fast Mode' enhances the module's ability to interact with HART-compatible devices through optimized command processing.

",What are the key parameters for configuring the EM 4 F-AI Ex HART module in safety mode?,"Key parameters include operating mode set to 'Safety mode', source and destination addresses, and monitoring time.","Configuration involves setting the operating mode, addresses, DIP switch settings, and monitoring time for optimal performance.","Essential settings are the operating mode, source and destination addresses, and a monitoring time of 2500 ms.",The module requires specific parameters like 'Safety mode' operation and a 2500 ms monitoring time for proper setup.,"To configure the module, adjust the operating mode, address settings, and monitoring time to meet safety requirements."

",How does the module handle channel faults according to the 'Behavior after channel faults' parameter?,"The module supports channels in managing faults, ensuring continued operation or safe shutdown as configured.","It allows for flexible response to channel faults, either supporting continued operation or initiating a shutdown.","Depending on the configuration, the module can either maintain operation or safely deactivate a faulty channel.",This parameter enables the module to adapt its response to channel faults based on predefined safety protocols.,"The module's response to channel faults is customizable, supporting either fault tolerance or immediate shutdown."

",What role does the 'Frequency interference' setting play in the module's operation?,"The 'Frequency interference' setting, such as 'SUP 50 Hz', helps mitigate electrical noise affecting the module's performance.","It configures the module to suppress specific frequency interferences, like 50 Hz, ensuring reliable operation.",This parameter is crucial for filtering out unwanted electrical noise that could disrupt the module's functionality.,"By setting 'Frequency interference', the module is better protected against electrical noise at specified frequencies.","The setting enhances the module's immunity to electrical interference, maintaining accuracy and reliability."

",What is the purpose of the 'monitoring time' parameter in the EM 4 F-AI Ex HART module?,"The 'monitoring time' parameter, set to 2500 ms, defines the duration for which the module monitors channel conditions.",It specifies the time window during which the module assesses channel statuses for faults or anomalies.,"This parameter ensures that the module actively monitors each channel for a set period, enhancing safety.",A monitoring time of 2500 ms allows the module to detect and respond to channel issues within a defined timeframe.,"The setting is critical for timely detection of channel faults, contributing to the module's overall safety features."

",How is the 'Measuring range' parameter configured for the EM 4 F-AI Ex HART module?,"The 'Measuring range' is set to '20 mA', defining the operational range for current measurements.","It specifies the maximum current, 20 mA, that the module can measure, ensuring accurate signal processing.","This parameter establishes the upper limit for current measurements, critical for safe and precise operation.","By configuring the 'Measuring range' to 20 mA, the module is optimized for standard industrial signal levels.","The setting ensures that the module can accurately process signals within the 0-20 mA range, common in industrial applications."

","What documentation provides detailed information on configuring S7F/FH hardware, including the EM 4 F-AI Ex HART module?","The 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)' and 'Operating Manual, 04/2018, A5E43228905-AA' offer comprehensive guidance.",Detailed configuration instructions are found in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety' and its associated operating manual.,"For S7F/FH hardware setup, refer to the specified compendium and manual for version 9.0 and the April 2018 edition.","The 'Operating Manual, 04/2018, A5E43228905-AA' alongside the compendium provides all necessary configuration details.",These documents are essential resources for understanding and implementing the module's configuration and safety features.
